newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's Packer tops rich list, again.
newsitem.headline: Australia's Packer tops rich list, again.

text.p: Australian media baron Kerry Packer has again topped his country's rich list, boosting his personal fortune to a peerless A$3.9 billion.

Packer, whose media empire owns Australia's biggest commercial television network and a stable of magazines, is now worth more than twice his nearest rival in the seriously rich stakes, according to figures published on Friday.
Australia's second richest, Frank Lowy, chairman of shopping centre group Westfield Holdings Ltd, is worth A$1.4 billion, Business Review Weekly magazine said in its annual "Rich 200" edition.
Packaging magnate Richard Pratt ranked a close third with A$1.3 billion.
But Packer is peerless, accounting for almost 10 percent of the total fortune of A$40.6 billion amassed by the richest 200.
In the past year, he has added another A$600 million, or A$1.6 million a day, to his personal wealth, the magazine said.
Packer's soaring fortunes mainly reflects the steadily climbing share price of his Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd, which has risen 26 percent over the past 12 months.
A high-rolling gambler, the 59-year-old billionaire has also made some quick profits on the green felt of casino tables.
In just 20 minutes at the Mirage casino in Las Vegas this year, Packer won 20 straight hands of baccarat at A$250,000 a throw, Business Review Weekly said.
But Packer is still a minnow compared with the world's richest men, Microsoft chairman Bill Gates, U.S. investment guru Warren Buffett and Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah of oil-rich Brunei.
Gates' fortune was last estimated at US$18 billion, ahead of Buffett on US$15.3 billion, according to Forbes magazine.
Asia's richest man, the Sultan of Brunei, is said to be worth an estimated A$30 billion, The Australian newspaper said in February.
Packer is also lagging behind his great Australian-born media rival, Rupert Murdoch.
The Los Angeles Business Journal this week's estimated Murdoch's worth at US$3.2 billion, making him the wealthiest person in southern California and marginally richer than Packer.
